title: Geth doesn't sync
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `Version: 1.11.0-unstable`
CL client & version: prysm@v3.1.1
OS & Version: Linux


#### Expected behaviour
I expect the geth client to start syncing.

#### Actual behaviour

I am trying to run full node on Ethereum mainnet; however, I believe geth doesn't sync. I started the GETH client with 

`geth --ws --http --http.api eth,net,engine,admin,txpool --authrpc.jwtsecret jwt.hex` 

Despite multiple attempts, it prints `looking for peers` for 2-3 times but then stops printing any information. 

All I see is, `beacon client online, but never received consensus updates. Please ensure your beacon client is operational to follow the chain!` 

I connected the consensus client and it is syncing but not the geth client.

This has been the case since ~12 hours.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Geth doesn't sync. I started the GETH client with 

`geth --ws --http --http.api eth,net,engine,admin,txpool --authrpc.jwtsecret jwt.hex` 


Logs

```
INFO [09-30|20:00:31.192] Persisted the clean trie cache           path=/home/ubuntu/.ethereum/geth/triecache elapsed=23.692ms
WARN [09-30|20:01:07.409] Beacon client online, but never received consensus updates. Please ensure your beacon client is operational to follow the chain! 
WARN [09-30|20:06:07.442] Beacon client online, but never received consensus updates. Please ensure your beacon client is operational to follow the chain! 
WARN [09-30|20:11:07.474] Beacon client online, but never received consensus updates. Please ensure your beacon client is operational to follow the chain! 
WARN [09-30|20:16:07.507] Beacon client online, but never received consensus updates. Please ensure your beacon client is operational to follow the chain! 
WARN [09-30|20:21:07.535] Beacon client online, but never received consensus updates. Please ensure your beacon client is operational to follow the chain! 
WARN [09-30|20:26:07.570] Beacon client online, but never received consensus updates. Please ensure your beacon client is operational to follow the chain! 
WARN [09-30|20:31:07.605] Beacon client online, but never received consensus updates. Please ensure your beacon client is operational to follow the chain! 
WARN [09-30|20:36:07.639] Beacon client online, but never received consensus updates. Please ensure your beacon client is operational to follow the chain! 
WARN [09-30|20:41:07.669] Beacon client online, but never received consensus updates. Please ensure your beacon client is operational to follow the chain! 
WARN [09-30|20:46:07.702] Beacon client online, but never received consensus updates. Please ensure your beacon client is operational to follow the chain!

```
This isn't a bug. The CL needs to be synced, first. A checkpoint sync for the CL helps.

> I figured this later, thanks.

I have the same issue. How did you figure it out?

Yes. Your consensus node needs to be synced first. Here is the question I answered on ethereum.stackexchange:

https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/questions/136810/geth-does-not-sync-proof-of-stake
